name: DigitalOcean
description: Upload file and folder content to DigitalOcean Spaces Bucket
author: Marcelo Forment√£o

inputs.name: digitalCredentials
inputs.label: DigitalOcean Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the service endpoint for your DigitalOcean connection.
To create one, click the Manage link and create a new service endpoint based on AWS configuration.

inputs.name: digitalRegion
inputs.label: DigitalOcean Region
inputs.helpMarkDown: The DigitalOcean datacenter region code (nyc3, ams3, sgp1, etc.) of the region containing the Spaces resource(s) the task will use or create.

inputs.name: digitalBucket
inputs.label: Bucket Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the bucket where the content will be uploaded.

inputs.name: digitalSourceFolder
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder that the content pattern(s) will be run against. If not set the root of the work area is assumed. You can use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988). Example: $(Agent.BuildDirectory)

inputs.name: digitalGlobExpressions
inputs.label: Filename Patterns
inputs.helpMarkDown: Glob patterns to select the file and folder content to be uploaded. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns and also exclude patterns.

inputs.name: digitalTargetFolder
inputs.label: Target Folder (Spaces key prefix)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The target folder (referred to as a key prefix in Spaces) in the bucket to contain the uploaded content. If not set the root of the bucket is assumed. You can use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988).

inputs.name: digitalAcl
inputs.label: Access Control (ACL)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The canned Access Control List (ACL) to apply to the uploaded content. Refer to [Canned ACL](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/acl-overview.html#canned-acl).

inputs.name: digitalFlattenFolders
inputs.label: Flatten Folders
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flatten the folder structure and copy all files into the specified target folder in the bucket.

messages.UploadingFiles: Uploading files from %s to %s in bucket %s
messages.BucketNotExistNoAutocreate: Bucket %s does not exist or you do not have access. Auto-create option not set, cannot continue.
messages.BucketNotExistCreating: Bucket %s does not appear to exist (or you do not have access). Attempting to create in region %s.
